newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares firm, further upside seen.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares firm, further upside seen.

text.p: Slovenian shares firmed 1.71 percent on continued foreign buying and market participants said growth was expected to last for at least another two weeks.

"Foreign demand is strong in line with a general trend of foreign interest in securities of the countries of Eastern Europe," said Danilo Grasic, head of the investment sector of the Slovenian branch of Creditanstalt bank.
* The ISB index rose 22.96 points to 1,368.8.
* Issue A of pharmaceutical company Lek was most actively traded, rising 4.63 percent to 28,920 tolars. -- Marja Novak, Ljubljana Newsroom, 386-61-126-3644
